results.title: Silk and strings: a tale of Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Bay Street Pictures Inc and Seabourne Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”.
Presents traditional aspects of Taiwanese culture. Contrasts the simple life, costumes, and art and crafts of the original natives of Taiwan with the culture of the Chinese. Focuses on the traditions of China as they are retained in Taiwan, including the cultivation of the arts, music, and calligraphy.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Bay Street Pictures Inc and Seabourne Enterprises

results.title: Synthesis = Synthese. No. 6/77 [English language]
results.brief_description:
French cinemagazine items: Agronomy - general ecology, applied on site to vegetation, provides agronomists with valuable information on the natural environment with a view to its eventual development. To meet the needs of the consumer, agriculture has to increase plant production on a vast scale while maintaining conformity with the parent-plant and this is the subject of laboratory research; as is the improvement of species through genetic selection and hybridisation. Agronomical research in the fight against pests that damage crops, has turned to biological methods that are both specific and innocuous, as for example, in controlling caterpillars.
Suitable for senior students.

results.title: Symphonie mechanique
results.creator_credit: Jean Mitry, Anatole Dauman, P.H. Lifchitz and Argos Films
results.brief_description: In this short experimental piece, Jean Mitry combined shots of industrial machinery with a contemporary score creating a poetic rhythm between image and sound featuring a score by French composer Pierre Boulez entitled ‘Musique Concrete’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Mitry, Anatole Dauman, P.H. Lifchitz and Argos Films

results.title: Surf sail
results.creator_credit: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Cook Strait, which separates the North and South Islands of New Zealand, is one of the most dangerous stretches of water in the world. Three people attempt to cross the Strait, with its unpredictable conditions, tides and currents, on wind surfboards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: The Supervisor as a leader. Part 2
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in supervision”
Four supervisors discuss the qualities of leadership with the assistance of dramatised incidents. One supervisor lets his job go to his head, while another goes to pieces under pressure. Emphasises that a good supervisor is not afraid to praise his colleagues for work well done and that he is loyal.

results.title: The Supervisor as a leader. Part 1
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in supervision”
Several workmen are asked what they consider to be the attributes of a good supervisor. The four most important qualities are: always keep promises, never take credit for someone else’s work, don’t pass the buck and don’t play favourites

results.title: Sunshine North Technical School (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”
Examines new techniques and attitudes toward the total library services in a co-educational technical school in Victoria (Sunshine North Technical School) with a large migrant student population.

results.title: Sunset country
results.creator_credit: David Corke and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: A record of an expedition of 12 people who crossed a little-known area of the Victorian Mallee known as the Sunset Country to find out more about the wild life that lives there. Members of the party included C. Austin, R. Boswell, D.G. Corke, D. Holland, M.A. Howard, F.E. Lobb, A.R. McEvey, E. Molesworth, G.M. Pizzey, H.M. Ross, H.N.B. Wettenhall. Commentary by Graham Lynden.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Corke and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.description: A record of an expedition of 12 people who crossed a little-known area of the Victorian Mallee known as the Sunset Country to find out more about the wild life that lives there. Commentary by Graham Lynden.

results.title: The Sun is our star
results.brief_description: The sun is the Earth’s source of energy and life. Describes the nature of the sun’s rays - ultra violet, infra red, heat and radio waves. Discusses solar spots, solar eclipses, and the polar aurora, their causes and effects such as electrical storms and radio disturbances.
